intro: Tacazzea pedicellata var. occidentalis, commonly known as the western tacazzea, is a flowering plant native to the western regions of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
